cats.name: Big Ben
cats.description: Big Ben is the Great Bell of the clock at the Palace of Westminster. Completed in 1859, it stands 316 feet tall and is a symbol of the UK, known for its distinctive chimes.

cats.name: Niagara falls
cats.description: Niagara Falls is a major natural attraction on the U.S.-Canada border, featuring three powerful waterfalls: Horseshoe Falls, American Falls, and Bridal Veil Falls.

cats.name: Eiffel tower
cats.description: The Eiffel Tower, completed in 1889, is a wrought-iron landmark in Paris, known for its distinctive design and stunning city views.

cats.name: Taj Mahal
cats.description: The Taj Mahal is a stunning white marble mausoleum in Agra, India, built by Emperor Shah Jahan in the 17th century in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.

cats.name: Giraffe
cats.description: A giraffe is a tall African mammal known for its long neck, legs, and distinctive spotted coat. It is the tallest land animal and primarily feeds on leaves from trees.

cats.name: White bear
cats.description: A polar bear is a large white bear native to the Arctic, known for its thick fur and ability to swim long distances. It primarily hunts seals and is well adapted to cold environments.

cats.name: Hawai
cats.description: Hawaii is a U.S. state located in the central Pacific Ocean, known for its beautiful beaches, volcanic landscapes, and diverse culture.

cats.name: City
cats.description: A city is a large, densely populated urban area with complex infrastructure, including buildings, roads, and services. It serves as a hub for commerce, culture, and governance.

cats.name: Desert
cats.description: A desert is a barren, arid region with minimal vegetation and low precipitation. It often features sand dunes, rocky landscapes, and extreme temperature variations.

cats.name: Farm
cats.description: A farm is a tract of land used for growing crops and raising animals. It includes buildings and equipment necessary for agricultural activities, such as fields, barns, and silos.

cats.name: Forest
cats.description: A winter forest is a wooded area covered in snow and ice, with bare trees and a quiet, serene atmosphere.
